body:
I've been jitter clicking for the past few hours and I feel fine, sure I'm a bit tired but I'm in no pain at all. Which got me thinking, is there any actual proof that jitter clicking will harm one's health? Is there any record of someone harming their health from jitter clicking?






ps Sorry if I've made a post like this before but I want to be fairly certain I won't mess up my arm/ hand.
body_tagged:
I've been jitter clicking for the past few hours and I feel fine, sure I'm a bit tired but I'm in no pain at all. Which got me thinking, is there any actual proof that jitter clicking will harm one's health? Is there any record of someone harming their health from jitter clicking?






ps Sorry if I've made a post like this before but I want to be fairly certain I won't mess up my arm/ hand.
title: Question :)

replies.body: IMO it's not worth jittering.  CPS isn't that important when pvping.  I click 10cps and I get very good combos.  For me, it's not worth jittering and hurting yourself.
replies.body_tagged: IMO it's not worth jittering.  CPS isn't that important when pvping.  I click 10cps and I get very good combos.  For me, it's not worth jittering and hurting yourself.

replies.body: I've been jitter clicking for 8 months and i'm perfectly fine. Just that You feel tired if you jitter like 24 hours without stoping
replies.body_tagged: I've been jitter clicking for 8 months and i'm perfectly fine. Just that You feel tired if you jitter like 24 hours without stoping

replies.body: Yes, it is possible to injure your hand, so you should probably make sure you're warmed up before jitter clicking.
replies.body_tagged: Yes, it is possible to injure your hand, so you should probably make sure you're warmed up before jitter clicking.

replies.body: I'd advise to keep in it moderation and don't base your entire PVP style off jitterclicking
replies.body_tagged: I'd advise to keep in it moderation and don't base your entire PVP style off jitterclicking

replies.body: Jitter Clicking is good for PVP however, I suggest you don't constantly use the method because it can strain your arm and do other similar things, so just watch out and as kycrafft said, keep it in moderation.
replies.body_tagged: Jitter Clicking is good for PVP however, I suggest you don't constantly use the method because it can strain your arm and do other similar things, so just watch out and as kycrafft said, keep it in moderation.

replies.body: Apparently you get banned on Avicus if you start jittering
replies.body_tagged: Apparently you get banned on Avicus if you start jittering

replies.body: Thanks for all your help! I've found an alternative (+ legit) method to click over 10cps :D
replies.body_tagged: Thanks for all your help! I've found an alternative (+ legit) method to click over 10cps :D
